workflow.name: AI-powered Product Hunt data collection & translation with GPT-4 and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
### This n8n template automates the collection and enrichment of Product Hunt posts using AI and Google Sheets. 

It fetches new tools daily, translates content, categorizes them intelligently, and saves everything into a structured spreadsheet‚Äîideal for building directories, research dashboards, newsletters, or competitive intelligence assets.

## Good to know

* Sticky notes inside the workflow explain each functional block and required configurations.
* Uses cursor-based pagination to safely fetch Product Hunt data.
* AI agent handles translation, documentation generation, tech extraction, and function area classification.
* Category translations are synced with a Google Sheets dictionary to avoid duplicates.
* All enriched entries are stored in a clean ‚ÄúTools‚Äù sheet for easy filtering or reporting.

## How it works

* A schedule trigger starts the workflow daily.
* Product Hunt posts are retrieved via GraphQL and processed in batches.
* A code node restructures each product into a consistent schema.
* The workflow checks if a product already exists in Google Sheets.
* For new items, the AI agent generates metadata, translations, and documentation.
* Categories are matched or added to a Google Sheets dictionary.
* The final enriched product entry is appended or updated in the spreadsheet.
* Pagination continues until no next page remains.

## How to use

* Connect Product Hunt OAuth2, Google Sheets, and OpenAI credentials.
* Adjust the schedule trigger to your preferred frequency.
* Optionally expand enrichment fields (tags, scoring, custom classifications).
* Replace the trigger with a webhook or manual trigger if needed.

## Requirements

* Product Hunt OAuth2 credentials
* Google Sheets account
* OpenAI (or compatible) API access

## Customising this workflow

* Add Slack or Discord notifications for new tools.
* Push enriched data to Airtable, Notion, or a database.
* Extend AI enrichment with summaries or SEO fields.
* Use the Google Sheet as a backend for dashboards or frontend applications.

parameters.content:
## Initialization
Starts the workflow daily and sets the initial cursor for pagination.

## Data Fetching
Calls the Product Hunt API and restructures each post into clean JSON fields.

## Duplicate Check
Looks up each tool by title in Google Sheets and only processes new entries.

## AI Enrichment
Uses an AI agent to translate text, map categories, extract tech, and generate documentation.

## Save & Loop Control
Writes enriched tools to Google Sheets and manages pagination until all pages are processed.

documentId.cachedResultName: Porduct Hunt Scraping Tools - AIC_DEV N8N
Porduct Hunt Scraping Tools - AIC_DEV N8N

parameters.jsCode:
const edges = $json.data.posts.edges;

const structured = edges.map(({ node }) => ({
  Title: node.name,
  TitleFrench: "" ,
  Description: node.description,
  DescriptionFrench: "" ,
  category: node.topics?.edges.map(t => t.node.name) || [],
  categoryFrench: "",
  tech: node.topics?.edges.map(t => t.node.name) || [] ,
  FunctionArea: "",
  UrlDemo: node.website,
  UrlGithub: "" ,
  UrlVideo: (node.media && node.media.length > 0) 
    ? node.media.find(m => m.videoUrl)?.videoUrl || null 
    : null,
  UrlLogo: node.thumbnail?.url || null,
  DocumentationMarkdown: "" , 
  DocumentationMarkdownFrench: ""
}));

return structured.map(item => ({ json: item }));

nodes.name: Fetch Products from Product Hunt API
AI Agent: Translate & Enrich Product Data

options.systemMessage:
=You are a helpful assistant. **Your tasks are:**

---

## **1. Translation**

* Create two additional fields:

  * **TitleFrench** ‚Üí French translation of the value in **Title** (keep the original Title as-is).
  * **DescriptionFrench** ‚Üí French translation of the value in **Description** (keep the original Description as-is).

---

## **2. Category Translation Handling with Google Sheets Dictionary**

* A Google Sheets dictionary exists with two columns:

  * **Category Name English**
  * **Category Name French**

### **Steps:**

1. Search for the **category** in the **Category Name English** column.
2. **If a match exists**, retrieve the corresponding value from **Category Name French** and assign it to **categoryFrench**.
3. **If no match exists**, translate the category into French, then:

   * Add a new row to the dictionary with:

     * Column 1 ‚Üí Original English category
     * Column 2 ‚Üí Translated French category
   * Assign this translation to **categoryFrench**.
4. **Ensure no duplicates are added. Always check before inserting a new row.**

---

## **3. Content Generation**

Based on the **Title**, **Description**, and **category**, generate the following fields:

* **FunctionArea** ‚Üí A short, meaningful English phrase summarizing the main purpose or domain of the product (e.g., *"AI for HR"*, *"Design Automation"*).
* **DocumentationMarkdown** ‚Üí A concise English guide (1‚Äì2 short paragraphs or step-by-step instructions) explaining:

  * What the product does.
  * How to use it effectively.
* **DocumentationMarkdownFrench** ‚Üí French translation of **DocumentationMarkdown**.
* **tech** ‚Üí A list of technologies mentioned explicitly in the **Description**.

  * **Do not infer or guess.** If none are mentioned, return an empty list.

---

## **4. Preserve Other Fields**

Keep all other provided fields and their original values as they are.


---

### **Example Input:**


{
  "Title": "{{ $json.Title }}",
  "TitleFrench": "{{ $json.TitleFrench }}",
  "Description": "{{ $json.Description }}",
  "DescriptionFrench": "{{ $json.DescriptionFrench }}",
  "category": "{{ $json.category }}",
  "tech": "{{ $json.tech }}",
  "FunctionArea": "{{ $json.FunctionArea }}",
  "UrlDemo": "{{ $json.UrlDemo }}",
  "UrlGithub": "{{ $json.UrlGithub }}",
  "UrlVideo": "{{ $json.UrlVideo }}",
  "UrlLogo": "{{ $json.UrlLogo }}",
  "DocumentationMarkdown": "{{ $json.DocumentationMarkdown }}",
  "DocumentationMarkdownFrench": "{{ $json.DocumentationMarkdownFrench }}"
}

---

## **5. Output Requirements**

Return a **valid JSON object** with **all the following fields**:

* `Title` (unchanged)
* `TitleFrench` (translated)
* `Description` (unchanged)
* `DescriptionFrench` (translated)
* `category` (unchanged)
* `categoryFrench` (from Google Sheets logic above)
* `tech` (list of technologies explicitly mentioned)
* `FunctionArea` (generated in English)
* `UrlDemo` (unchanged)
* `UrlGithub` (unchanged)
* `UrlVideo` (unchanged)
* `UrlLogo` (unchanged)
* `DocumentationMarkdown` (generated in English)
* `DocumentationMarkdownFrench` (translated to French)


---

### **Important Rules:**
Before adding any new category translation to the Google Sheets dictionary:

First, check the Category Name English column in the sheet.

If the category already exists, directly use the corresponding French translation from the sheet (categoryFrench).

Only if it doesn't exist, translate the category to French and:

Add a new row to the sheet:

Column 1 ‚Üí Original English category

Column 2 ‚Üí Translated French category

Do not add duplicates under any condition.

Output only valid raw JSON, with no markdown formatting (no ```json) and no stringified JSON.

Do not return explanations, notes, or wrappers ‚Äî just a pure JSON object or array, machine-readable.

The final JSON must be fully parsable by automation tools like n8n without modification.

parameters.content:
## üìã Product Hunt AI Enrichment Workflow

This workflow automatically discovers new Product Hunt tools, enriches them with AI-generated insights, and stores everything in a structured Google Sheet. It helps you build and maintain a living database of Product Hunt launches without manual copy-paste.

### How it works
Every day, a schedule trigger calls the Product Hunt GraphQL API with cursor-based pagination. For each post, the workflow restructures the data (title, description, topics, website, media) and checks your Google Sheet to avoid duplicates. Only new tools are sent to an AI agent, which translates the title and description into French, maps categories using a dictionary sheet, extracts any explicitly mentioned tech stack, and generates simple English/French Markdown documentation. The enriched record is then saved to your Tools sheet, and the loop continues until there are no more pages or the safety limit is reached.

### Setup steps
1. Add your Product Hunt OAuth2 credentials to the HTTP Request node.
2. Connect your Google account and select the Tools and Category Dictionary sheets.
3. Add your OpenAI (GPT-4.1-mini) credentials.
4. Adjust sheet IDs, ranges, or column names if your structure is different.
5. Enable the daily trigger when you are ready to run it automatically.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
